subject: Philosophy
title: The Hard Problem
description: Learn The Hard Problem in one minute.

hook.text: Science can explain how the brain works. But it can't explain why anything feels like something.

buildup.text: David Chalmers coined 'the hard problem' in 1995: why does subjective experience exist at all?

discovery.text: We know neurons fire. But why does firing neurons produce the taste of chocolate or the feeling of love?

twist.text: The easy problems ‚Äî how the brain processes info ‚Äî are hard enough. The hard problem may be unsolvable.

climax.text: After decades, neuroscience still can't bridge the gap between brain activity and felt experience.

punchline.text: We know the brain thinks. We don't know why it feels.

quiz.question: What is 'the hard problem of consciousness'?
options: Why subjective experience exists at all
